attributes.action: Force the Scottish Government to conform to UK tax rates
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the Scottish Government operates a different tax rate system than the rest of the UK. This leads to working people having far more of their income taken away every month than someone on the same salary, living elsewhere in the UK. This can be thousands of pounds more each year. This is deeply unfair, especially in a cost of living crisis.
attributes.background: The Scottish tax system should conform with the rest of the UK. Scottish people shouldn't be taxed more than someone on the same wage, living elsewhere in the UK.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government and Scottish Parliament is responsible for. 

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: https://petitions.parliament.scot/

You may also wish to contact your local MSP who represents you about this issue.

You can find the name of your local MSP and how to contact them here: https://www.parliament.scot/msps
